turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: So none of us knows who's paying the freight, this is just some anonymous job. For all we know, we're working for different people.

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: Now that is an interesting proposition.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Don't talk to me unless you tell me what I want to hear, understand?!?  You have no choice in this, don't think about winning, think about staying alive.  I want the item, and if you don't give it to me, I'm gonna kill you.

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: I don't have it with me...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Bullshit!

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: I swear...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Then where is it?

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: I sent it to myself in Paris.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Sent it where?

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: A post office box.

turns.speaker: PHONE VOICE
turns.text: Is it done?

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: It's done.

turns.speaker: PHONE VOICE
turns.text: Gregor, is that you?

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: Much to your disappointment, no doubt.

turns.speaker: PHONE VOICE
turns.text: It was a mistake, it shouldn't have happened.

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: I'm in the middle of saving you people a great deal of money -- the least you could do is have the decency to pay me!

turns.speaker: PHONE VOICE
turns.text: So what do we do?

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: What I do is none of your concern.  What you should do is wait for my next phone call.  I'm going to find a place where I can tilt the field in my favor.  When I'm ready, I'll call you and tell you what I want you to do.

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: How so?

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: Because if there's more than one party involved, if we really are working for different people, then perhaps some of us are on different sides.  Your orders might be different from mine.

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: I would imagine that the great satisfaction in all of this will be killing the American.

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: I hadn't thought about it.  Understand me, Gregor -- I take no pleasure in killing.  It doesn't bother me one bit, but I don't get off on it.

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: A means to an end, is that it?

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: Then I guess we're set.

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: There is one other thing...

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: Don't cross me...

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: Nobody's going to do that!

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: I need you, Swede, I can't do this without you!

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: I just wanted to make sure you knew who you were dealing with.

turns.speaker: GREGOR
turns.text: I do, I do...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Hello, Jean-Pierre.

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: Hello, my friend.  He doesn't look French to me, Vincent.

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: He's tough, your American friend.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Yes, Sam's tough alright.

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: And you respect him.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Of course.  Don't you?

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: I've never seen a man who could have taken what he just went through.  He's a cop?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Not exactly.

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: Not exactly?  But close enough, eh?  So he saved your life, then?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: How did you know?

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: If he hadn't you'd have put a bullet in his head a long time ago.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: American.

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: Well, Vincent's American friend, shall we see what we can do for you?

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: Are you sure you won't have a drink?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No booze...Pain's in the mind, and the mind I can control.  Alright, let's do it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You think you can stitch me up on you own?

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: Don't worry, we'll take care of it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Then if you don't mind...  I'm gonna pass out.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Some, thanks.  Enough to move on, for now.

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: You should really let a doctor look at that.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Soon.

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: But first you have something to take care of?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: Something important?  A thing that cannot wait?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It gets done now or not at all.  Another couple of days and the parties concerned are gone where I can't get them.

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: Forgive my intrusion into your affairs, but I am the one who connected Vincent to this job, his agent, if you will.  He is one of my oldest friends and I owe him a great debt, much like the debt I suspect he owes you.

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: He sees this differently, as you well know.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I didn't expect that he would.

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: You suffered through an agonizing pain last night, pain you could have avoided by declaring yourself an agent of the law.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Vincent told you that I'm a cop?

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: Not a word.  But no ordinary criminal would have the extensive military and medical expertise you do.  And so I place the pieces of the puzzle together in a way that makes sense to me.  You work for some government agency and you carry a gun, and in my world, that makes you a cop.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: So this is what, a test?

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: Call it a reckoning of character.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: If I was healthy, I could take that away from you.

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: Perhaps.  But you are not healthy, and if you try I'll kill you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: So what is it you want to know?

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: I suppose I want to know how a man like you is created.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Created?

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: Perhaps forged is a better word.  Like steel.  Like a sword.  You're a modern Samurai.  I've spent my life around extraordinary men -- men like Vincent. But I've never seen anyone like you.  I'm afraid Vincent will die if he goes with you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Vincent's life is his own burden; he'll have to carry it for himself.  And I'm not any kind of Samurai.

turns.speaker: JEAN-PIERRE
turns.text: You seem one to me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: A Samurai has honor, a Samurai live by the code of Bushido, the way of the warrior.  I'm just a killer for hire.  The world isn't about honor, anymore. It's about survival.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: The point remains: we could be working for different people.  There's a chance for one of us...  Maybe more than one of us -- has been paid to cross the others.  I don't know about you guys, but I like to know who I'm working for.  It can help prevent a great deal of...  ...unpleasantness.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Anybody tries to unpleasant me I'll put two between his eyes -- one to do the job and the other to make sure it takes.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You shoot alright.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Gets the job done.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: All in the stomach, though.  Your man might live.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Not for long.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Long enough to shoot back.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Is that right?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's been known to happen.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Why don't you go do better, then...

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Yeah, well...  My way works too.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: My way is better.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's a cocktail.  Mostly demerol, cut with a little crank because we might need you awake in the real near future.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Fine with fucking me, we got work to do. I don't care what it takes, we are getting our property back and putting it into the hands of the people who are gonna pay us a great deal of money when we do.  I don't know about the rest of you guys, but I'm not the kind of guy to just sit back and take it in the ass.  I don't mean that in, like, a literal way...

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: What are you gonna do, call him up and ask him to give us back our shit?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Did he bring that with him?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: What're you talking about, man?  I don't understand.

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: What a surprise...

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I got a surprise for you, blondie...

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: They call me Swede.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Who's they?

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: Everybody.

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: You should watch what you eat.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Who the fuck died and appointed you food czar?

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: I'm just worried about your health, Larry.  You could stand to shed a few pounds.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: And you could stand to get a little smarter, ain't that right you dumb blonde fuck?

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: Who you calling dumb, dickless?

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: I ride with fat-boy...

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Eat shit and die slowly...

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: After we stop the target car I get out and use the heavy artillery to kill the driver and his bodyguard.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I blast the lead car into oblivion...

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Where is this broad?

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: You should learn a little patience.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Is that right?

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: It's consider a virtue in some corners of the world.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Not in mine.

turns.speaker: SWEDE
turns.text: I don't particularly like killing, tubby, but I want you to know that this one I'm going to enjoy.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Sorry I'm late...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: What makes you think we're here to meet you?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Who else would you be?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Perhaps the police?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I know cops -- and you're no cop.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Cigarette?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He trusts you to lock up?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Let's just say he knows who I am.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I'm Vincent.  And I coordinate.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Coordinate what?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Things.  This is my country, you know.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Where to?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: To see a man about a thing.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I can do that.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Pretty much what you'd expect.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: That's what I thought.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: He says this is their block.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: As in, they own it?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Something like that...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: And I suppose he's saying that we oughta give them something for using it, huh?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I didn't know that you spoke French.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't.  But the language he's speaking is universal.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What'd you say to him?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I asked if we could give him anything else.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: That was a nice move you did on our young friend.  Judo?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jujitsu.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Same thing, isn't it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Not at all.  Similar, but not the same.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: What's the difference?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: One's a lot more painful than the other.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Help yourself.  Since when do you smoke?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I have, I don't know, maybe a cigarette a week.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: A cigarette?  As in one?  One cigarette a week, who smokes like that?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Christ, I smoke a pack-and-a-half a day, and I tell myself I could be worse.  It's just so damned pleasurable.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It has it's moments.  Course, you get cancer and die, that's the down side.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: There is that.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: So, Vincent: why bring me along for the ride?  Job like this calls for a warm body, somebody who can stand around and look threatening.  A tough guy.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Like Larry or Swede.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Exactly.  Why not bring them?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Let's just say I thought the conversational possibilities were limited.  Of course, I might have brought Gregor, but he didn't seem like the right candidate -- for this.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Watch that one, he's an ex-spook for sure, maybe Stasi, maybe KGB.  He's smart, Gregor is.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: So is the woman.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Deirdre?  Smart, yeah, and seriously goddamned dangerous.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I wonder if she truly left the IRA.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I've wondered that myself.  None of this answers my question, though...  Why bring me?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I wanted to see who you were.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Who am I?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You were once some kind of special forces.  Airborne Ranger, maybe a Navy SEAL.  After that you rode shotgun for the CIA in some place like El Salvador or Afghanistan, a real mercenary.  Only now -- now you're like the rest of us, it's a very competitive market since the end of the cold war.  There's a lot of hired guns out here, and not nearly enough work to go around.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: That's right: there's not hardly enough work these days, nothing that pays the big money, anyhow.  Then along comes this job, paying so much goddamned money I couldn't afford not to take it.  Somebody's paying through the nose for this.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: They certainly are.  Whatever it is we're going to steal, it must be quite something.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Whatever it is it must be goddamned priceless.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Lovely, isn't it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: They'd have to keep something like this under lock and key in New York, and it would still get fucked up.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I just wanted to see something.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: See what?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I needed to know.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You need to know a lot of shit, Vincent.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You know, what you pulled back there, that was bullshit.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I needed to see if you were a cop.  I'm a popular man with the police, Sam, and whenever they try to catch me they always do it with an inside guy -- some man on some job who seems more trustworthy than all the others put together.  And that's the guy you have to watch out for.  I hate cops...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well I ain't a cop.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: How did you know?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Know what?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: That there was a gun pointed at me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I saw you look off when Francois nodded his head.  I figured he wasn't pointing out a particularly rare shrub, and the rest was easy.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: But how did you know I would have the presence of mind to pull my weapon when I did?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Because that's what I would have done...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: The question still remains: what do we do now?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Gregor's cell phone...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You weren't around when I woke up, I thought maybe something had happened.  This has been one very fucked up job, Sam, and I'm not taking any more chances on anybody...  Including you...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I came up here to sneak a smoke.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You were smoking?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I hope you don't mind I took your pack. It was on the table.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Please, help yourself.  Smoke as many you'd like.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I borrowed that, too...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Of course...whenever you feel like it just help yourself.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I have a feeling I'm about to start buying my own.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It was at that.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: A lot of people died.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I've seen a lot of people die before.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I haven't.  Not like that.  How do you get used to it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You don't.  You just learn to live with it.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I won't lie -- there have been times when I had to do it, times when the only way to get out alive was to see that the other man didn't.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: We live in a singular world, my friend.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I never really thought I was part of the world you move in, Sam, to tell you the truth.  I'm a hood, a thief.  Big time in a small time king of way.  To the local police I'm a prize, to the local hoods I'm a legend.  But to a guy like you I'm just another two bit hired gun.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You might be a hired gun, Vincent, but I got a feeling you cost more than two bits.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He's going back.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Not necessarily.  He could go off road at any number of places.  He might not even be in the country anymore.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's Paris.  The route's too indirect for anything else.  A guy like Gregor, he doesn't waste time on this road unless he has to be on it in the first place. Otherwise, he'd be out of the country by now.  He's going to Paris.  Now I just hope we can find him before he gets there.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You're a cop...you're a fucking cop...I should kill you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: But you can't.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: That makes twice now you've saved my life.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I didn't save your life back there. Risked it, maybe -- but I didn't save shit.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You see it your way, I'll see it mine. You need a doctor.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You know one around here?  Somebody you trust?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: No...I thought I'd take you to the hospital.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No hospitals.  I'll fix this myself if I have to.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Fix it yourself?  Why are we even doing this?  There's no need to run, Christ...  You're a cop.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Not exactly.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You're with Interpol -- you're a cop.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: If I was a cop, a real cop, I'd have busted you a long time ago.  This isn't about you, it's about the job I have to do.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: And what job is that?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: My job, Vincent, a job you don't need to know about.  I can't go to the local cops -- they'd never be able to get close enough at this point.  It's me or nobody, and I've been on this job too goddamned long not to finish.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: It looks to me like we're all that's left of our group.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: We?  There is no we in my world now, Vincent, just me.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I'm going with you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This doesn't involve you, don't you understand?  I can't even guarantee you any money out of all this.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: It isn't about money for me, not anymore.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You don't have to do this.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Yes I do.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Alright, it's done.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You see the bullet?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Clearly.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Good.  Now take the forceps, and remember, Vincent, what we're doing here is routine.  I've done stuff like this at least twenty times in the field.  There are no vital organs where you're working, no major muscles or arteries -- you can't kill me.  Just make sure you've got the bullet before you try to pull it out.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You know him?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I know of him.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: The Irish representative?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: The address of the Russian production company.  Just in case we need to find them.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thorough man.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You sure your friend got the right place?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: If Tony says this is it, then it's it.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Tell me, Sam: why do you do this?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Do what?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Continue when it would be so much easier to give it up.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's my job.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Then quit.  You don't work for Interpol, Sam.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Sure I do.  You heard him, you heard the guy -- that's what he said, what Edvard said.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: It's a cover, then.  A cover within a cover, a feint within a feint.  You work for the CIA, it's the only possible answer.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm a field agent -- last of an already extinct breed.  I do dark ops.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Dark ops?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Dark operations.  Wet work.  Kidnaping. Assassination.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Very ugly.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It is at that.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Not very zen of you, huh?  Not so much the modern Samurai after all.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I never made that claim.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I know.  Jean-Pierre did.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You were behind the door?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I was waiting to see what would happen. I didn't want to kill him if I didn't have to.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You would have done that?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I would have tried not to.  But yes, if it would have kept him from shooting you, I would have.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: How could you have done that?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Because I owe you.  Look at that...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: They don't have the package.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You think?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You said it yourself: Gregor's not dead. If they had the package, they'd have killed him.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: What the fuck happened?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You don't know?  Bullshit, you had her, there was no way out.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Give me a cigarette.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Right now?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Gimme a goddamn cigarette!!!!

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Why are you driving?  You're not French, you don't live here, you don't know these roads.  Why are you driving?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I'm not here very much.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Business keeps you on the road?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Something like that.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I know I don't need to say this to you, but I need to say it to you.  This is my job, I have to do it.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: So I do it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No you don't, and you know it.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: If our positions were reversed, would you leave me?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: In a minute.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I think not.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Do we need anything else?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yeah.  We need out fucking heads examined.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Not here.  They might see it.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: If I'm going to die for the CIA, I'm going to go out smoking.  Besides, there's half a forest between us and them, they can't see a goddamned thing.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Time to quit.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Just like that?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Not just like that... Just before I turn around and it's six months from now and the first thing I do when I wake up in the morning is light a cigarette.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: What of it?  Samurai pain in the ass.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Would you stop with that...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Why?  You've got more force of will than anyone I've ever seen.  You handle a gun like it's a part of you, you perform surgery on yourself without anesthesia...  And most amazing of all, you quit smoking, just like that.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: The mark of a true Samurai.  What I do for the Company, Vincent, is no different than what you do.  We're both hired guns, and this is a job -- like any other job.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Why then, Sam, don't you act like this is a job like any other?  Surely, if you are a hired gun, you realize that some times you just have to walk away without getting what you came for.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Because I don't walk away.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's the one thing I've got left to hold onto.  Jean-Pierre is one of your closest friends, is he not?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Closest and oldest.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: And yet you would have killed him to save my life.  You have a sense of honor, Vincent, that I can't even remember anymore.  I don't know that I ever even had it to begin with.  All I know to do, Vincent, is to finish my job.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: And when you finish?  What then?  This package, whatever it is, do you give it to the CIA?  Do you really think they deserve it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: That's a good question.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Do you have a good answer?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No, I don't.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You have to stop doing that!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'll work on it...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Let's get him out of here...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Finish the job...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: And now...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Finish it!

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You son-of-a-bitch...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You speak French.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What of it?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Nothing...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: "Your field dressing saved his life." That's three I owe you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You don't owe me a goddamned thing, Vincent, and you know it.  You stepped in front of a bullet for me.  I owe you a heavy debt.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You better get some sleep, alright?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Tell me something first.  The package: what was it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know.  Nobody knows, except a bunch of people who are too dead to tell us.  There's probably a couple of guys back at the Company who know, but I don't think they plan to tell me anytime soon.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: What happened to it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Gone.  Destroyed.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I guess that's for the best.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I told you, I quit.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Just to keep me company, Sam -- I hate smoking alone.  How about you?  I thought all you IRA types smoked.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's the story?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: It's an international thing.  Several different peoples involved, criminals from all over the world, experts brought together to do a job.  But maybe the most interesting thing about it is that preeminent in the plot we find the Russian Mob and the IRA in bed together. An unlikely group of partners.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Gaelic.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm sure.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Why's that?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Cause the Russian production company would be easier to find.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's the Irish tape we want.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Gonna be tough.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Last I heard there was a film rep for the Irish players staying at this address, name of Seamus Reilly.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Seamus Reilly.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Why didn't you kill her?

turns.speaker: SEAMUS
turns.text: Why didn't you kill him?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You slept with her!

turns.speaker: SEAMUS
turns.text: How is it these fellahs managed to get the drop on us?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You slept with her!

turns.speaker: SEAMUS
turns.text: You should have kill him when you had the chance.  But no...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You put everything on the line because you...

turns.speaker: SEAMUS
turns.text: You slept with the fucker!!

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: My man, how you doing?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I'm alright.  And you?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Doing well.  This is?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: A friend.  I was telling him about how you always have the latest tapes.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Why don't we step into my office...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I was wondering if you had any movies that were particularly new.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Matter of face there's this flick I've been hearing about.  I haven't seen it, but from what I hear it's pretty cool.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Do you have the tape?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: I might know where you could get a copy.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: What I've heard so far, it's all a lot of talk.  I wasn't so sure what to make of it at first, cause, like I said, the Irish and the Russians are an unlikely mix.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You said you might know where we can get a copy of this tape?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: All depends on whether you want the Russian or the Gaelic language version.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Can you get it?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: The Russian would be easier.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Seamus Reilly, boy's a serious Irish Auteur -- a real firebrand.  Thinks his more moderate filmmaking brethren have turned to making movies for peace-loving pussies, if you see what I'm saying.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I get the picture.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Tony and I have to talk some business, first.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: I gotta try and overcharge him, he has to moan about the price, we settle somewhere in the middle.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: It's a matter of respect.  Why don't you wait outside, this won't take long.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Sort of!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Hey Dwayne why don't you introduce him to your funeral parlor cousin?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: What the hell happened here?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Looks like some kind of drug deal or something, they're not from around here --  one of them's still alive.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: I'd like to know what they were doing in my town!  Did you get ID off any of them?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: None of them had any --

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Damn.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: I want to get some hounds down here.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Whatsamatter with you?  Aren't you concerned about all of this?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I can't get enough of it.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: I should kill you right here! I never thought you'd do this to me but I guess there's a lot I didn't know about you!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Dwayne listen to me -

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Shut up!  Not another word out of you!  You're going down, the Feds know all about it!  You didn't know some of it was marked, did you! Where's the rest?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I don't know what you're -

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Don't lie to me!!!!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Ready to roll, partner?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Sure thing, and --

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Don't spend it all in one place.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I knew you'd come through. Jesse observes the transaction Booth and Earl start to leave.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: How old is Otis anyhow, thirty?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: The horniest dog in Nevada.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Thanks for the loan, man.  I'll have it in a few days, I promise.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Well I hope so.  That pretty much cleaned me out.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I would have asked my sister, but its better to leave family out, always leads to trouble.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I hear you.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Yeah...I remember my brother-in-law Gary, the wheel watcher.  He finally got on the show and won seven thousand dollars!  Plus some leather furniture. Do you think I saw any of that?  His excuse was the government got it all.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Seven thousand...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: He would have won more but he blew it at the end.  Didn't know what Cash and Carry was.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Cash and what?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Cash and Carry, you know, FDR, World War two...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Never heard of it.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Oh, you would have done great.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I probably would have.  I guess the clues damn near before everyone.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: That's what everyone thinks.  But according to him, when it's the real thing, it's quite an intimidatin' environment in which to concentrate.
